result.execSummary:
The defendant Latoia E Ball was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Latoia E Ball is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Latoia E Ball was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 64 days, if revoked.
May serve probation in IL.
22CF92 & 21CF1609 are concurrent w/ each other.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not have contact with Pleasant Prairie Outlet Mall, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  May serve probation in IL

of DNA Collection at Conviction
and Elements
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
for Reduction of Bail filed by Atty VanCuick.

02:12 PM
Defendant Latoia E Ball appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Defendant in custody.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Fel Flee/Elude Officer;
Found guilty by the court; Cts 2 & 3 were dismissed on State's motion.
Parties waived PSI report and proceeded to sentencing.
Ct 1:
Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions.
64 days sentence credit if revoked.
May serve prob. in Illinois.
Court costs ordered; no restitution requested.
Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.
Submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge (unless previously provided).
21CF1609 to run concurrent to this case.
Appeal rights given.
Jury selection on April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am. RE:  Speedy Trial Demand made on 3/2/2022.
The 3/10/2022 Final Pre-Trial has been rescheduled to 3/28/2022 at 1:45 pm due to a week long jury trial going on.
filed by Atty VanCuick
